website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive storage container is ideal for buyers who need a single, high-capacity jar.
pros: Glass does not stain and doesn't take on food odors
Snug-fitting brushed metal lid for style

customer_reviews.title: Nice for storing dry goods
customer_reviews.text: Nice for storing dry goods. Loses one star because the ridge on lid is unfinished (I actually sliced my finger while washing it) and the rubber seal is a little distorted so I have to twist the lid to make it sit flush to the jar. Overall, nice product though. The attached picture shows the 2.5-gallon jar with 10 lbs. of sugar on the left, and the 1.5 gallon jar with 5 lbs. of flour on the right.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cookie Jar!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a cookie jar and the 1.5 Gallon Montana Jar was a great choice! The picture included in my review shows the jar with almost 9 dozen cookies in it (cookies made with a standard sized cookie scoop) The jar seals nicely so my cookies stay fresher longer! Also looks great on my counter top! Plan to purchase more! If this review was helpful please click "Yes" ~thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Treespinner

customer_reviews.title: The 96oz jars are the perfect size to store dryer sheets and scent crystals
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these jars for my laundry room makeover. Because it is located directly off the kitchen and we leave the door open so that the dogs can get to their food, it is important to me to have all of my products neatly displayed. The 96oz jars are the perfect size to store dryer sheets and scent crystals. The glass on the jars is fairly substantial, meaning they don't seem fragile if they get knocked or banged. The lids have a plastic gasket underneath that make them appear somewhat airtight. When I lift the lid there is definitely a suction sound. I would definitely buy these jars again!
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Jen

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! Breaks during simple hand washing.
customer_reviews.text: This glass jar is dangerous. I've used it to feed my sourdough starter for large bakes. This year TWO jars have broken while gently hand washing in tepid water. Jars never subject to heat or cold. One jar broke along seams that run up along jar. Last night this jar cracked along seams and the bottom completely broke off! Thankfully I was not severely cut, but certainly could have been.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product - Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Nice for storing dry goods. Loses one star because the ridge on lid is unfinished (I actually sliced my finger while washing it) and the rubber seal is a little distorted so I have to twist the lid to make it sit flush to the jar. Overall, nice product though. The attached picture shows the 2.5-gallon jar with 10 lbs. of sugar on the left, and the 1.5 gallon jar with 5 lbs. of flour on the right.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jars!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! I searched everywhere for nice canisters that had a seal and in which I could put my flour and sugar. LOVE the Montana jars. I've included a picture of the 96 oz jar which holds a bag of sugar and the 1.5 gallon jar which holds a 5lb bag of flour with plenty of room to measure a cup. I tried to put a 5 lb bag in a 96 oz jar, but it wouldn't all fit.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Anchor Hocking Montana Glass Jar with Airtight Lid, Brushed Metal, 1.5 Gallon
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my niece so when it arrived I opened it to make sure all was intact, it was. With it I opened I put a 5lbs bag of Haribo Original Gold-Bears Gummi Candy inside, as you can see it fits with much room left. The lid fit snuggly and secure even when placed on it's side empty. Also, picture shows packaging was sturdy for it's delivery.
customer_reviews.author: eric2959

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these jars!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite purchases to date. I wanted jars for my sugar, brown sugar, and confectioners sugar. These are perfect for that! I am able to fit a 5lb bag of sugar, a 2lb bag of brown sugar, and a 1lb bag of confectioners sugar; in order from biggest to smallest jars. They are not completely air tight, but I wanted a jar where the lid was easy to remove and still provided cover for the products inside. Love these! The only downside is the tops are rough painted black and can scratch/scuff easily. They are beautiful, but something to note.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Not really airtight!
customer_reviews.text: I do love the look and feel of these jars and am using them for storing flour, sugar, cornmeal, etc. They work well for this purpose because of the wide opening that you can easily get a measuring cup into! I've never had a problem with insect intruders being able to enter the jars, so I know they seal fairly well. However, my sugar solidified in the container over a fairly short time, so they don't really keep the dampness in the air out of the jar. On the search for a truly airtight seal on a different container. Not ideal, because they won't match my other canisters now :-(
customer_reviews.author: Lynne M. Laurinec

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Literally broke the second I got it out of the box.. the lid is barely soldered on and just snapped right off. I can probably glue it back on but it's a very low quality item
customer_reviews.author: Chellsea

customer_reviews.title: Look great and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and some chalk labels to make laundry cleaning supplies more organized and I’m glad I did! They look awesome and the quality of the jars is fantastic. I really like how large they are and can store Costco size bulk items. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Anchor Hocking Montana Glass Jars are the best jars for storage of any small or medium items you want sealed yet visible. I have these in many different sizes and lid colors. Excellent Product! One tip: I will leave them in my cart for a while to see if the price drops. If the price increases, I continue to wait and not order until the price drops to what I am willing to pay.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Conway

customer_reviews.title: Best containers for dry bulk staples.
customer_reviews.text: I finally have something for my giant bags of rice! and it will last forever. Sorry, Its products like this that make living on food stamps much easier. I don't want to use all plastic for long term storage, since that can be bad for food, and now I can actually buy an important staple in bulk easily, and not have people "accidentally" spill a whole bag of rice everywhere. I wish it was cheaper, or I would get more to get everything I can in bulk, and have a safe and healthy place to put it. It will take time, but I will have a matching collection for my own kitchen someday.
customer_reviews.author: john cocks

customer_reviews.title: Great for Lush bath bombs
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2 gallon jar specifically to hold Lush bath bombs. I almost bought the 2.5 gallon one but I’m glad I switched to the 2 gallon at the last minute because it’s already way bigger than I thought it would be. If you’re not familiar with Lush, their bath bombs are enormous, and this does a great job of storing lots of them! In the photo that I included, there are 11 bath bombs and 1 bubble bar in the jar and there’s still room for more. Plus, this is such a pretty way to store them in my bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C.

customer_reviews.title: 1 broken and 1 missing a lid
customer_reviews.text: These are super cute- but... I ordered 3. 2 came perfect and 1 was missing a lid. Ordered a replacement. It came broken. Returning the broken one. Box came with no padding. I now have 3 but it was a pain. And like other people mentioned the metal lid is sharp and will cut your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: Charged for 4 got 1
customer_reviews.text: Only got one of the glass jars, from an order of a set of 4. No place to let Amazon know I love the product, but hate the outlet where I can post that I am missing the other 3 from a set of 4. WHERE is the rest of my order??????
customer_reviews.author: Arthur L. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Still holding up.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these a few years back. The rubber seals on the lids are still perfect. The glass is nice and thick. We own 5 of them in various sizes for flour, sugar, beans, and wheat. We've even had brown sugar in one and it didn't get clumpy hard at all. great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CAMcMama

customer_reviews.title: I loved the jars
customer_reviews.text: I loved the jars, hated the lids. Description said stainless steel. They were rough painted black. Disappointed. Am returning. Wish they could just send the right lids
customer_reviews.author: R. D.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Service
customer_reviews.text: We do Whole Food Plant Based, no oil following Dr. Caldwell Esselstyn’s Heart Program. My cholesterol has dropped 70 points. So I do a lot of home cooking. I have a bunch of these for holding pantry items. I LOVE them. They are very thick glass. The most solid I’ve ever seen. (And I’ve been a jar collector for years.) They are very wide mouth- easy to use a measuring cup out of, and look fantastic. I’ve had many compliments on how nice they look. Wash them by hand, and be gentle with the tops and you will have them you’re whole life.
customer_reviews.author: SOEXCITEDUSA

customer_reviews.title: Nice until it's not
customer_reviews.text: Started out as a really nice container. However, the lid is somewhat fragile as it broke into 5 pieces after just 8 months of moderate use. May be worth considering a higher quality item at a higher price that will last years, not months.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Baynes

customer_reviews.title: KOMBUCHA TIME!!! READ FOR BOTTLING RECOMMENDATIONS
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended in a book for brewing Kombucha. It is the best deal for this purpose, don't mess with the spigot ones, they get clogged and you have to purchase the stainless steal spout. Just use a auto siphon with a bottling wand when bottling for ease, you dont need the siphon but will need tubing and preferably bottling wand.
customer_reviews.author: samuel

customer_reviews.title: Extremely cheap. The glass thickness of the last few ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheap. The glass thickness of the last few Anchor Hocking jars are paper thin, one breaking just by lightly setting down the jar. Closer inspection of the jar glass reveals bubbles within the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. Benz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: You can find better used jars at a garage sale. All the hardware was shipped loose inside the jar and rattling around. No instruction and was missing the lid handle. Save your money and pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Parker

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Bought 2 sets! Air tight lids!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Went back and bought another set, you get to 👀 everything in them. You can keep so many different items in them. Cookies, crackers, nuts bolts, vitamins in them too, so you don't have to open all those bottles. life-saver for me, so now I take them.edit: I noticed some people say not air tight, they are surely airtight. I put cookies in 2 wks ago and they are still fresh and crisp. They have a good suction on lid which works better than any I've ever had and I'm 79 yrs of age. Again well worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: editor.

customer_reviews.title: Quality jars at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: These are so nice for the price! I’m using them to store my laundry items. They are a quality, thick glass, and the lids seal nicely. They were bigger than I was expecting, and that was a plus. I will definitely purchase more to use in my kitchen in the future.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wisniewski

customer_reviews.title: Big & Beefy!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a canister that seals for our non-standard size k-cup coffee. This Montana Jar works perfectly. It's big, it's beefy and it hold a huge amount of k-cups and keep the fresh. It arrived in perfect condition with no imperfections. I told the wife I want another so I could fill it with peanut M&Ms....nummers!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff  🚑 & Jeff's Wife 💅Top Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Not useful as canister for storing dry foods
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, the metal lid was dented. I ordered this to store flour and other dry baking products. I prewashed the jar and lid. I had to disassemble the lid since I was going to use it for products I didn't want to clump. The plastic gasket around the inner lid came off when I unscrewed the handle. When I tried to replace the gasket, it would not stay in place, so the lid was not secure. I cannot keep flour, sugar, beans or other food items in this since it is potentially accessible to ants, weevils, and other small vermin. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: the silicone seal broke/no longer worked after removing the lid ...
customer_reviews.text: the silicone seal broke/no longer worked after removing the lid for the first time after washing. buy a different jar.
customer_reviews.author: rn

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality lid.
customer_reviews.text: Jar arrived intact however the handle you have to attach to the lid was just a piece of threaded rod tack welded onto a small flat piece of metal was not attached. Considering the look of the weld i'd say no one is doing any kind of QC on them because it was obvious from both sides of it there was no penetration and would have failed immediately. I ended up using an old drawer knob that doesn't really match but I'm using the jar to ferment miso so no one's going to see it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JessieTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Lid is a plus vs others.
customer_reviews.text: I use this large jar to store in shell peanuts, I like to feed my Blue Jays, Cardinals and squirrel and myself as well. I had this size jar before but with a glass lid, inevitably the lid was dropped and broken so rather than replacing the lid I replaced the whole jar and lid with this. The lid has a rubber o-ring seal so it is a little more airtight than the old glass lid type. Keeps peanuts fresh. I like this jar and would advise anyone wanting a large glass jar like this to get one with this type of lid.
customer_reviews.author: Greg R Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Very nice glass jars
customer_reviews.text: I really like this glass jar. Very good size, it is not super air tight but definitely better than other glass jars I've purchased previously.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Starr

customer_reviews.title: Big jar
customer_reviews.text: Very big jar. 5-pound bag of flour fills it about 2/3. Lid seals well, easy to open. Jar is large. I put felt feet on mine so they won't scratch up the counter. Don't plan on moving this often. Truly a jar of size. I bake a lot of bread and have one for white flour and one for wheat. Everyone admires the expansiveness of my jars. I feel both attractive and empowered now that I have jars able to hold an immense volume of stuff. Definitely buy a bunch of these -- if anything can change your luck for the better, it's got to be a bunch of huge jars. God loves these jars.
customer_reviews.author: Moggadeet

customer_reviews.title: Not useful as a canister for dry foods
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to store flour and other dry baking products. I prewashed the jar and lid. I had to disassemble the lid since I was going to use it for products I didn't want to clump. The plastic gasket around the inner lid came off when I unscrewed the handle. When I tried to replace the gasket, it would not stay in place, so the lid was not secure. I cannot keep flour, sugar, beans or other food items in this since it is potentially accessible to ants, weevils, and other small vermin. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: For dry storage only
customer_reviews.text: I tried putting makeup towelettes in this one. The top started rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Pettey

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Just wish they weren't so expensive
customer_reviews.text: I do love these. I got 2 sets, one for the kitchen and one to decorate the laundry room and hold detergent, etc. Looks so cute. They arrived quickly and well packed. I'm waiting now for more to come into stock. Have been waiting for about 3 weeks so far. ;-( Would love to get at least one set for my daughter-in-law. Did I mention how cute they are?
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Westcott

customer_reviews.title: Flour and sugar
customer_reviews.text: the most perfect container for flour and sugar! This size holds a 5 pound bag of sugar or flour -the lids have a gasket but it’s still easy to remove. So happy to have replaced plastic containers with glass. They fit perfectly in my corner cabinet and I can see when I’m running low. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Karen P

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! Terrible lid craftmanship!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I took off the lid the whole thing fell apart! I tried screwing it all back together to keep the handle on, however it wont seem to tighten and rubber seal keeps falling off and is super flimsy and floppy. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: jessica vanderbilt

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and it seems to keep things dry and fresh.
customer_reviews.text: Just wish the sizes were different... They don't seem to get larger at the same rate, which makes them look funny on the counter. The largest jar is much larger than it should be... Or the medium jar is much small than it should be. You decide.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Happy bettas
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in the 1.5gal size for my bettas. They are quite heavy when full (duh, right?) but not unbearable so. The bettas seem happy and the containers themselves are very thick and sturdy. Would recommend for use as a fish bowl
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Thickness and sizing is great
customer_reviews.text: The dimension and thickness of the 1.5 gallon is amazing. Its a great size to fit my 9lb of quinoa in there. The packaging was great but the amazon driver she literrally just drop them on my doorstep. I can hear the glass and lid clatter from the inside of my kitchen. There was a small crack but I dont think it'll do any big damage so I kept it from returning it. Thank you for making a great product.
customer_reviews.author: QT

customer_reviews.title: Get the brushed steel, not the black.
customer_reviews.text: Only one regret with this purchase is getting the wrong color. The black lids get dusty fast and can't just be wiped down like the steel ones. The black texture painted on the lids snags just about any cloth or duster you'd use to clean it. The only way to keep them looking clean is to hand wash them in the sink once a week. Functionally, they're otherwise perfect and look great on the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: JonM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for storing five pounds of cat food
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for storing 5 pounds of cat food. It also keeps the food fresh! In the past, when we worked our way through a bag of cat food, inevitably, the food would become less fresh in the non-airtight bag and my cat would notice and not want to eat it. Now she is happy because this jar keeps the food nice and fresh for her finicky tastes. Plus the jar looks much nicer than a bag of cat food, so we can leave it out on display in our small condo.
customer_reviews.author: F.S.A.

customer_reviews.title: Glass had several scratches
customer_reviews.text: When my product arrived it had a couple of rather large scratches on the glass, it not worth my time to return it, I can only hope it doesn't break.
customer_reviews.author: Review101

customer_reviews.title: Broken Handle
customer_reviews.text: I know I could just try to return this but it is very far to drive to the UPS store from where I live and I was wondering if I could just get a replacement handle? It broke immediately after we received this. Our other canisters are great. Seems like an easy fix, just send me this piece that's shown and save a lot of trouble with mailing and all that. I will gladly update my review if it all works out.
customer_reviews.author: Laura T

customer_reviews.title: 2 Gallon size Holds a 10lb bag of Sugar - Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I was unsure what size to order. I was glad I went with the 2Gallon size. It holds a 10 lb bag of sugar with some room at the top to spare. The quality is great. I’ve owned another one of these types of jars from pottery barn since 2012 that I use for storing flour. This seems to be a nearly identical match in material and quality. It was super easy to wash and dry. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This jar was perfect for what I wanted to use it for. Since I am not storing food, I did not need the airtight feature. The lid doesn't seem to be as airtight as I would like if I was holding food. Since I am only using it for paper, it works perfectly. I did notice the glass had a scratch on it that almost looks like an etching. I've just been trying to ignore that little spot.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: I love my Anchor Harding Montana glass jars!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Anchor Harding Montana glass jars, this is exactly what I wanted for my small pantry remodel. Having a glass pantry door made the contents visible to everyone wether I liked it or not, therefore I decided to bring my esthetically pleasing pantry to fruition! My daughter and I removed the ugly wire shelves and custom built floating shelves for my small L shape pantry. The Anchor Hocking glass jars helped me achieve an esthetically pleasing pantry!
customer_reviews.author: Brittni

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: These are incredible, air tight, large opening. It's perfect to store my puppies treats and dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Jks

customer_reviews.title: Defective- Chancy Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a container for bread flour since mid May 2020. I made bread from the flour in that jar almost weekly. I late August it was about 1/4 filled and I set it on my counter as always. I took three cups of flour out but when I lifted it back to put it away the jar had split in almost a perfect circle about 3” from the base. Flour everywhere. This was a defective jar and for $30 this should not happen.
customer_reviews.author: Emery98

customer_reviews.title: Love These
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these. I wanted to display them on my counter tops with flour and sugar. The rubber gaskets have kept moisture out of both flour and sugar. They were delivered in perfect shape. After getting these large size, I ordered the smaller 3 set. Highly recomend.
customer_reviews.author: ALouF04

customer_reviews.title: Love these jars!
customer_reviews.text: I am In love with these beautiful jars! They're nice and big for my sugar, oatmeal and flour and super easy to open and close. The jars have a great seal and look beautiful on my countertop. A great addition to my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: dena l.

customer_reviews.title: Very attractive and perfect for dog food!
customer_reviews.text: The 1.5 gallon jar is the perfect size and shape for dog food. It is squat and fits under the cabinets on my counter top, but holds a large volume of dry food (enough for over a month for my medium sized dog). The wide mouth of the jar lets you use any type of scoop with ease and there is no trouble reaching to the last bits at the bottom of the jar. This made my life so much easier! The only issue of note is that the knob of the lid comes loose with a lot of use, but it's really easy to tighten with just your hands from underneath. Would buy again and again!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Cross

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I needed some large containers for dry goods in my kitchen after the ones I had for several years finally broke. I found these and i love them. They are glass unlike my old ones and so I can easily see what is in each one. The lids are air tight to keep the food fresh and keep any random ants or bugs from finding their way in. They have many sizes to choose from so I can find one for all my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cash

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE BEST COOKIE JAR I'VE EVER HAD. GOOD SEAL AND CAPACITY FOR LOTS OF COOKIES, WHICH IS HOW I BAKE. EASY TO WASH. USE CAUTION WITH THE TOP/SCREW AREA WHICH IS JUST COMMON SENSE
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great-ish
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking everywhere for a set of containers for my counter top. Initially I wanted stainless steel but I didn't find any that really grabbed my attention. I figured I'd try these out. They are great! Very sturdy, keep things fresh but the only downside is that sometimes when I open it the lid sometimes it drops small black pieces from the lid. Other than that they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Ylemchata

customer_reviews.title: Makes a beautiful unconventional fish bowl!
customer_reviews.text: I carefully purchased this item to give my two fish a new bigger home. Going from 2 smaller 1 gallon bowls to this 2.5 gal beauty. The glass is thick and I don't have to worry about leakage issues as I've had from cheap small fish aquariums. I am customizing with colorful decorations as well as live plants. My fish are happy as can be! 🐟
customer_reviews.author: Nursie2335

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well-sealed.
customer_reviews.text: We use this jar to store dry cat food. It holds a seal excellently -- it's almost difficult to pull off the lid sometimes, due to the vacuum. I have not seen a problem with bugs in it, and don't think they are likely to get in. On the down side, the knob at the top tends to come loose regularly. We have to pinch the screw underneath the lid and rotate the knob to re-tighten it. Neither an upside nor a downside: The lid makes a faint ringing sound as it dings against the side of the glass as it opens. This meal bell announces that food is here, so the cats swarm it.
customer_reviews.author: SJ and SF

customer_reviews.title: Was missing the lid.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this would have been a great lidded jar... if it actually came with a lid. The glass itself is sturdy and heavy though. Contacted customer support, so hopefully I'll be able to get a lid. I'll update this review pending that interaction. **Edit** They ended up sending me a whole new jar! Which is nice, but now I have one large jar without a lid and one large jar with a lid.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Very practical, easy to clean, thick & robust glass
customer_reviews.text: This is a great jar for the money. The lid has a rubber gasket which seals fairly tight. It will definitely keep air out, but it might not keep liquid from spilling if transporting it. It is very easy to clean as one's hand fits comfortably through opening. The glass is thick (coke bottle) so it will take a really hard drop to shatter. 5 stars for the price and simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Danilitos

customer_reviews.title: Ants do find there way in
customer_reviews.text: I live in he tropics and and ants are a constant challenge. I am happy I purchase a couple of these larger jars. I leave the sugars and flours in their package, put a rubber band around them, and then place them in the jars. They provide another barrier, but a few tiny ambitious ants still get in.
customer_reviews.author: M Broussard

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: this arrived in a thousand pieces. I couldnt even open the box
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Pantry Staple
customer_reviews.text: These are good looking, high quality, substantial jars. I have several of these in different sizes for storing flour, sugar, tea, etc. The lids are air tight, and the 1.5 gallon jar will hold a full 10 lb bag of flour, sugar, etc.. The opening is wide enough to reach in with a handled 1 cup measuring cup easily, and the lids are not difficult to take off even though they are air tight. Given the size, these are heavy when they're full and can be cumbersome to pull out of a pantry, but these are by far my favorite jars for storing baking ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very thin glass
customer_reviews.text: This canister is made from very thin glass. I barely bumped it accidentally with a cup glass cup I was holding and it shattered everywhere. The glass cup was fine. It was filled with dried beans, so what a mess that was to clean up! I bought this canister less than a month ago. Also, the the top lid is not airtight,
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Used to store our dog food
customer_reviews.text: This container seals the food for freshness and keeps the food sealed from the dog. We leave this next to our dog bowl and it looks so much nicer than the bag. We purchased a scoop to help get the food out. I like it so much I might start buying bulk cereal and storing it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Momwith2boys

customer_reviews.title: Love this jar
customer_reviews.text: Love this jar! I originally purchased it for my laundry room, but I underestimated the size. At 1.5 gallons, it's too large for what I had in mind, so instead, I replaced my all glass Anchor Hocking 2 gallon jar with this one in my kitchen for rice. I love look of the aluminum cover, and although I would not say that it's completely airtight, it closes nice and tight. The only reason it didn't get a 5 star from me, is that I feel the lid could be a little thicker. The aluminum seems a little sharp. I'm going to purchase the 64oz. for my laundry room :)
customer_reviews.author: Mirtha A.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: These definitely look nice, but that’s where the positivity ends. They are certainly not airtight. The rubbery seal inside the lid comes loose every couple times I open the jar. So pointless. Total waste of money, but I got rid of the packaging too soon, so can’t return. Oh, and the best part is, just as other reviewers stated, when cleaning the lid, it will absolutely slice your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful......  and American made
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful metal finish , brilliantly clear glass, perfect lid closure Skip the poisonous products from the east... Support our businesses here at home.
customer_reviews.author: Manly man

customer_reviews.title: This looks great
customer_reviews.text: These canisters are nice and they look great on my counter. When they came there were dents in the covers. I was able to push some of it out. When I put them on the side boards you couldn't tell that the dents were there. I would buy these again but the 4 stars are because of the dents.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Dirty & deformed
customer_reviews.text: Hard to tell in the photos but this arrived with brown gunk, deformed marks on the glass & smudges all over the lid that wont come off- i will be spray painting the lid so you cant tell anymore- but honestly i was really looking forward to this and it was not that great :( wouldnt recommend
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Arrived in good care
customer_reviews.text: These do not have a tight suction grip but they do have a decent enough amount that I will still use them for what I purchase them for they are bigger than what I expected but I’m terrible with measurements so that’s not the company‘s fault LOL overall I am satisfied with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Rieger

customer_reviews.title: Good jars!
customer_reviews.text: Here is a pic for anyone wondering- the left jar has a 5lb bag of flour in it and the right has a 4lb bag of sugar. I bought the 1.5 gallon jars. They work great, have a good deal and show me how much is left. Happy shopping:)
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Green

customer_reviews.title: It's not worth
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little disappointed! These jars are not cheap. I was expecting much better quality jars. The jars are misshaped, has a lot of flaws in the glass. The knob on top of the lid is crooked. I'll keep because I don't want to deal with the hassle in returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly80

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Attractive Jar
customer_reviews.text: I love this jar which I use for storing flour. The opening is large enough that I can reach in with a two-cup metal measuring cup, fill it, and withdraw it without difficulty. The sturdy glass construction is attractive and keeps the flour fresh. It is ideal for use in baking.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking option for pet food
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, this is the best price on these - I comparison shopped around and I could not find a better price or a bigger mason/mason style jar to store pet food in. Based on the previous reviews I decided to wash out the jars in case there were glass fragments in the bottom (I didn't see any but other reviews mentioned it so I wanted to be safe) and it was quick and easy. I'm using these to store dry dog and cat kibble because I think it looks nicer than the pet food bag sitting on the floor, and so far I am very pleased :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rust. Not airtight. But just pretty glass canisters.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of the black metal. Lids have some rust inside. Not an airtight canister. Stored my brown sugar in the medium canister, didn't think about it hardening later until i needed to use the brown sugar. It's a pretty sight to see in the kitchen with clear glass canister sets but think about what you're putting in them.
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for storage, sturdy and heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these to help contain bathtub items and keep two people's items separate. I LOVE these! They are pretty large inside, the lid seals around the glass with no problems and they are strong and sturdy. They don't have drainage so if using in the bathroom like myself you'll need to clean them out every once in awhile to prevent mold buildup, but these are really perfect for so many different things. I'll be buying more in the future for pantry items for sure! Can't recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lozenich

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 3 Jars, 2 great, 1 bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for a Smores Bar last month for our Wedding Celebration. They are beautiful. However, after the party, one of the lids no longer has a suction on it and therefore, will not keep food fresh. I was going to return it, but by the time I got to it, the return window through Amazon had just closed, so I'm stuck with a pretty jar that isn't usable in my kitchen now. I wish I could get a replacement seal or lid for it. Oh well....
customer_reviews.author: Shannon O

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate cookie and snack jar
customer_reviews.text: Perfect container for cookies, brownies, dessert bars and snacks. The lid has a seal making it fairly airtight so staleness doesn't really set in. It's a pretty big jar with a good size opening. As mentioned, the seal on the lid is fairly tight so it does take some effort to pull it off. The jar itself is glass and seems to be a good quality. I had hoped it would have been slightly thicker but so far so good in my household. This jar is also suitable for holding flour, sugar or other items you may need to store in a fairly airtight condition. Definitely would recommend this item if you have the room for it.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS JAR
customer_reviews.text: I use it to keep flour. The most convenient thing about this type of jar is that you don`t need to unscrew lids. And I like how these jars look. I have 2.5 and 1.5 gal. Perfect. It`s probably not airtight, but there are no bugs appear inside (have used them for almost a year)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy storage jar.
customer_reviews.text: I reorganized my pantry and ordered glass jars to store basics like flour,sugar,cornmeal,rice,etc.I ordered this jar last.Wow,it's really big! Very heavy glass with nice brushed nickel top which has a rubber gasket to seal the jar. I would recommend this storage jar to anyone.A little pricey,but you get what you pay for. It's really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mdsimms

customer_reviews.title: Nice Jar. Appreciate the minimal but secure packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice large jar. The lid is not 100% airtight but it is fine for my purposes. It is a nice looking jar. I very much appreciate that there was zero styrofoam or plastic used in the packaging and the box was 100% recycled cardboard. It was also packed very carefully and you could tell there was no way it could rattle around in the box.
customer_reviews.author: T. A.

customer_reviews.title: Great canisters!
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these for my cookies, kcups, teas, hot cocoa packets, and sugar packets. My kitchen is a primitive decor and these for right in. Really nice to look at, easy to clean, and keeps everything fresh.
customer_reviews.author: fluffysquirrel

customer_reviews.title: I love them, but came damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Love these so much. Just wish they wouldn’t arrive damaged when they are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: SHATTYcakes

customer_reviews.title: Great quality glass jar
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful glass jar. I got the 2.5 gallon jar which was a little too big for me and i wasn’t sure what to put in it. I tried all my onions and potatoes but it ended up getting wet inside. It didn’t work for me but I still give the quality 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: janelle acain

customer_reviews.title: Nice and large, holds a large box of detergent.
customer_reviews.text: I recently redid my laundry room and wanted a nice container for my powder detergent that wasn't tipped. This is perfect for holding a large box of detergent and looks and seals really nice. I purchased a second one for my pods to place next to this.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed & not happy
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed...opened the box and one jars (smallest one) was placed upside down..then I looked at the largest jar, the lid is damaged!!! The box is not damaged, just the product...wth...it did not state in the description that the product is damaged, if I would of known that, I wouldn’t of bought it...Not happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I use them for canisters for flour, sugar, brown sugar and powdered sugar. I wanted clear canisters and something nice to look at. They are on a floating shelf in my kitchen and they complement my decor so great! Good quality, a rubber seal in the lid and heavy durable glass. I'm very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: While I love these containers
customer_reviews.text: While I love these containers, they are not "sealed" by the lids. I put Brown sugar in one, and within a week, the Brown sugar was hard as gravel. The ants that visit each spring also had NO PROBLEM getting in. The "seals" on the lids aren't broken or damaged - they just don't work. I have at least 8 of these containers in different sizes and they are all this way. Other than that issue though, they are great and attractive storage.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I had some concerns that it would get to me in one piece, but it was fine. The only oddity is that it was SUPER dirty. Underneath the knob to pull it open was black and fuzzy. After scrubbing, it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SprinklyDonut

customer_reviews.title: HUGE and very ATTRACTIVE
customer_reviews.text: These food storage containers are HUGE. Perfect for large quantities of rice and flour, with a nice wide mouth for crackers, cookies, or any dry storage. They are very nice looking with an attractive stainless steel lid that fits snugly, not completely air tight, but snug anough for keeping dry food fresh for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta S.

customer_reviews.title: These jars are for DRY STORAGE ONLY
customer_reviews.text: The 2 gallon jar is decent. The lid seems a bit flimsy though, and has sharp edges. I originally bought this for making kombucha, but unfortunately found out (via a sticker warning on the bottom of the lid) that this jar is for dry storage only. It's unfortunate this was not mentioned on the product description on the website. I'm now using it to store flour, and it works well for that purpose. If you are planning on storing liquids, keep looking for another jar, as this one is not suitable for fluids.
customer_reviews.author: Enlightened Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for flour!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jar originally expecting I'd use the larger 2.5 gallon one as a flour canister and this one for sugar, but it turns out that this jar was the better option for flour! It's a decent size and can hold just under two full 5 lb. bags of flour. It has a really wide opening, which is nice for reaching in and scooping out flour. The seal seems to be decent, and I think it'll be airtight enough for flour. Looks really nice on my counter! I bought a 0.5 gallon jar with a glass lid for my sugar instead. I'm following the reviews on there to make that jar airtight as well.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Keller

customer_reviews.title: Great jars for great price.
customer_reviews.text: Product was exaru as described. I was worried at first because some reviews stated that the kids were sharp. I’ve had no problems so far. The are sturdy and look great. Got them for the laundry room.Will order more for other uses. I was going to go to local store to buy, but I love shopping from my couch. Arrived on time and packaged well. I Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SheilaMc

customer_reviews.title: Large size holds a lot of cookies!
customer_reviews.text: I like the see through aspect of this cookie jar! I can actually put a whole package of cookies in it- - plus! It is bigger than I thought but that's because I didn't read the description as completely as I should have, but it fits and looks fine on my counter. Nice heavy durable glass and a metal cover that fits on tightly to eliminate moisture and humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy Packer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous and sturdy and perfect for many uses!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased four of these to use to store part of the multitudes of seashells I have collected during beach trips over the years! The large mouth jars are perfect to fit conch shells in and the thickness of the glass allows me to pick the jars up with confidence, knowing they can be shifted to different locations in my home for display! I will definitely be ordering more of these! Carefully packaged by the company and shipped quicker than expected!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet B.

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with a few issues 😣
customer_reviews.text: While I alln pleased with its size and look for the most part,I an disappointed in the condition it came in. The handle on the lid was bent and discolored. I suppose I will be painting the lid to fix the issues. I'll have to sand it smooth if I want to use a metallic paint though. I also wish that the lid cane off smoothly. It rubs the metal and textured paint.
customer_reviews.author: Serah

customer_reviews.title: New means new, not covered in scratches!
customer_reviews.text: Covered in scratches, dings and damage, and the lid was barely screwed together, crookedly. Huge disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Hester

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I stacked my cookies in this jar like the Chrisley's. I love this jar. I have matching candy jars that are smaller. This jar has kept my oreos fresh from August to November. It is a big jar so for some people they don't like how much room it takes up.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Dorsett

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is big, solid Glass, a little heavy, solid, top comes off really easily but still has a nice seal. I love this thing because it lets me keep all my loose things all in one place and nice and neat in the pantry.
customer_reviews.author: zachus

customer_reviews.title: 2 gal. jar holds 10 lbs of flour.
customer_reviews.text: Buy dry goods in large amounts, freeze for 48 hours, store in airtight containers. This is what we do with all our grains, beans, popcorn, oatmeal, and flours. These jars are large and airtight. I've had to occasionally tighten the lid handle on this one or that one over the years, but that's the only thing even remotely like a problem I've experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wilson

product_meta.title: Anchor Hocking 1.5-Gallon Montana Glass Jar with Fresh Seal Lid, Brushed Metal, Set of 1
product_meta.description: Size:1.5 Gallon (Individual)| Color:Brushed Metal LidA perfect place to store cereals, pastas, flour, sugar, or any of your favorite items! this jar is perfect for registries, new homeowners and holidays. Anchor glass is made in the USA.
feature_bullets: INCLUDES: This Anchor Hocking glass jar set contains (1) 1. 5-gallon jar with brushed metal lid. A tighter seal for fresher food. Made of all-clear glass.
DURABLE: These glass jars with matching lids are wide mouthed and thick walled to ease scooping, prevent spillage, and protect what you buy.
SAFE: Anchor Hocking glass is healthier than plastic and metal. It will not warp, stain, retain smells, or leach dangerous chemicals into food or drinks.
USE: These glass jars are perfect to store and display all manner of dry goods including flour, cookies, rice, coffee, spices, candy, and much more.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,910 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
